summary: Valentine’s Day surprise website with a landing page asking “WILL YOU BE MY VALENTINE”, Yes/No buttons (with the No button evasive on hover/touch), and a follow-up gratitude page shown after clicking Yes; both pages should use the provided images as full-page backgrounds.
architectural_notes: Use the uploaded images as CSS full-page backgrounds on both pages (cover/center, behind content) while preserving button interactions and readability.
known_issues: Deployment/build encountered a technical error; user requested a retry.

existing_features.title: Create a landing page that displays the prompt text exactly: "WILL YOU ACCEPT MY LOVE" and shows two prominent buttons labeled "Yes" and "No".

Implement evasive behavior for the "No" button: whenever the user tries to interact with it (mouse hover/mouse down/touch start), the button should move to a new random position within the visible viewport/container without becoming unreachable (i.e., it stays fully visible and clickable).
When the user clicks/taps "Yes" on the landing page, navigate to a second page that displays a gratitude/love message (English text) expressing appreciation/love.
Apply a cohesive Valentine’s-themed visual design across the site (consistent colors, typography, spacing, and button styling) using a distinct style (avoid blue/purple).
Add generated static image assets to enhance the Valentine’s theme and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images from the backend).
Add the uploaded image file "3a6059bf59d32f6f27e0496b5424853a.jpg" as a static frontend asset and render it on the first (Landing) page.
Add the uploaded image file "2fe29e3f61a6e53093c503c181238cdc.jpg" as a static frontend asset and render it on the second (Gratitude) page.

Ensure the new images visually integrate with the existing Valentine theme (spacing, rounding/shadow if needed) without breaking existing layout, button interactions, or navigation flow between pages.
Update the Landing page main prompt text to exactly: "WILL YOU BE MY VALENTINE" (all caps), replacing the current "WILL YOU ACCEPT MY LOVE" text.

Use the provided uploaded images as full-page background images on both pages: set /assets/3a6059bf59d32f6f27e0496b5424853a.jpg as the Landing page full-screen background, and set /assets/2fe29e3f61a6e53093c503c181238cdc.jpg as the Gratitude page full-screen background. The background must cover the viewport (cover/center) and remain behind all existing content without breaking the Yes/No interactions or the page navigation flow.
Retry the full build and deployment of the current application to the Internet Computer, using the existing codebase and assets without introducing new product features.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create starting page with the prompt “WILL YOU ACCEPT MY LOVE?” and Yes/No buttons
Make the No button move to a random position whenever the user touches/tries to interact with it (evasive button behavior)
On clicking Yes, navigate to a second page that displays a gratitude/love message
Change the landing page prompt text to “WILL YOU BE MY VALENTINE”
Use the provided uploaded images as full-page background images on both the landing and gratitude pages

If the retry fails again, capture and include the complete build/deployment error output and apply the minimal necessary fixes (code/config/asset path issues) to make the deployment succeed, without changing user-facing behavior.

projectName: Valentine’s Day surprise site with evasive “No” button and gratitude page
